newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Australian Oppn says Hanson should go.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Australian Oppn says Hanson should go.

text.p: Australian Opposition treasury spokesman Gareth Evans added his support on Monday to plans to oust independent politician Pauline Hanson, saying she was not making a positive contribution to parliament.

"I would like to see her out of politics altogether, and I think by the time the next election comes the Australian electorate will be intelligent enough to realise she's making no positive contribution whatsoever," Evans told reporters.
Media reports said Liberal and Labor Party powerbrokers forged a deal over the weekend under which both parties would direct their preferences to each other at the next election.
Asked if the move would push Hanson into the Senate, Evans said: "We've got so many problems in the Senate, I don't think it could make them any worse."

Hanson sparked outrage from both major parties when she used her first speech to parliament in September to proclaim that Australia was being "swamped by Asians" and called for an end to immigration and aboriginal aid programmes.
